sub_title: Author 'Desnoods met wapens' and NY Post & Amazon bestseller 'Seducing and Killing Nazis;' TEDxSpeaker; Women’s Leadership; International Author/Speaker/Lawyer/Lecturer/Consultant
summary:
Sophie Poldermans is the author of 'Desnoods met wapens. Hannie Schaft, Truus en Freddie Oversteegen: het indrukwekkende verhaal van drie jonge vrouwen in het Nederlandse gewapende verzet tijdens de Tweede Wereldoorlog' (Boekerij, 2023) and the New York Post & Amazon Best Seller 'Seducing and Killing Nazis. Hannie, Truus and Freddie: Dutch Resistance Heroines of WWII' (USA, 2019). She personally knew Truus and Freddie Oversteegen from these books for 20 years and worked closely with them as a board member of the Dutch National Hannie Schaft Foundation for over a decade. Earlier, she published 'Hannie Schaft. Haar rol in het Nederlandse verzet tijdens de Tweede Wereldoorlog' (AO, 2003).

She is a best selling author, international speaker, lecturer and consultant on women's leadership in (post) conflict areas, advocating women's rights around the globe. She is residing in The Netherlands.

Sophie is a passionate, driven and inspirational speaker embracing justice and peace and a dedicated entrepreneur.

www.sophiepoldermans.com 

In addition, Sophie is an excellent networker, connecting people and ideas, embracing design-thinking, strategic thinking, creativity and innovation. She shows both people driven and result oriented leadership as well as thought-leadership.

An open-minded, international and intercultural oriented, transparent environment is an asset, where world citizenship, sustainability and self-entrepreneurship are considered a true enrichment.
